fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4850].
  {panel}

When getting email notifications about comments being added, it is very easy to loose the context of the comment thread - especially when the comment is just "good idea! I'll get on it". I know there is a link which you can click to open up the web browser and go to page but there are situations where this is impractical (e.g. when reading through 100 notifications in your in-box in the morning and wanting to stay in your mail client) or impossible (e.g. when catching up with your mail notifications while on the train).

My suggestion is in the case of a comment being a reply-to that confluence appends the current comment thread (omitting the rest of the comments and page content). There are a few areas where this could be improved further:

1. If there are many comments in the thread (eg: 10 deep) it could be cut down to, say the latest 3.
2. If the past comments are very long and verbose (eg: stack traces) that it could be summarised with either the first 300 characters or somehow detecting and truncating large chunks (like stack traces).

Note that the newly added comment should be shown in its full entirety.
fields.summary: Comment Nofitication Emails can loose the Thread Context

fields.description:
There is an issue with one of the pages on CAC (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/JIRA+Portlet+Macro) where there is an embedded resource included from another page, which appears as a broken image when viewing the page. However, when you edit the page in the rich text editor, it displays fine. It does not display in preview mode.

It appears that the page ID of the attachment is incorrect, somehow.

In the rich text editor, the URL is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/145958/copy-link-to-clipboard.png

On the page (when viewing), it is:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/139435/copy-link-to-clipboard.png

(139435 is the ID of the "JIRA Portlet Macro" page)

This could be due to the embedded resource being on a separate page, the link itself having lowercase characters, when the page the attachment is on has mixed case (although a local test could not reproduce this). It could also be a caching issue.
fields.summary: Embedded resource not resolved when viewing a page, but works in rich text editor

fields.description:
Problem Summary:
standardHeader() macro in macros.vm is non-XHTML-compliant, inconsistent with other included/generated HTML.

Problem Discussion:
I'm trying to track down a sudden browser display problem in my Confluence set-up, so I happened to run a validator against the page, trying to quickly locate some bad HTML.  What a nightmare!  The source was filled with all kinds of missing stuff or syntactically invalid HTML (even for HTML 4.01 Transitional).  This particular report concerns HTML generated by the standardHeader() macro in macro.vm.  Here's the macro in Confluence 2.0/2.0.1:

#macro(standardHeader)
    ##infoPanelInit() we  now initialize the info panel in the content decorator

    <META HTTP-EQUIV="Pragma" CONTENT="no-cache">
    <META HTTP-EQUIV="Expires" CONTENT="-1">
    <script language="javascript">
      var contextPath = '$req.contextPath';
    </script>
    #if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.spacekey"))
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="$req.contextPath/styles/main-action.css?spaceKey=$sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.spacekey")" type="text/css" />
    #else
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="$req.contextPath/styles/main-action.css" type="text/css" />
    #end
    #if (!$sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.allowindex"))
        <meta name="robots" content="noindex,nofollow">
        <meta name="robots" content="noarchive">
    #end
    <link rel="shortcut icon" href="$req.contextPath/images/icons/favicon.ico">
    <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="$req.contextPath/images/icons/favicon.png">
    <script src="$req.contextPath/decorators/effects.js"></script>

    #if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.rssautodiscovery"))
        $sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.rssautodiscovery")
    #end
    #if ($sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.headsection"))
        $sitemeshPage.getProperty("page.headsection")
    #end


#end



The following snippets aren't XHTML-compliant:
1)
    <META HTTP-EQUIV="Pragma" CONTENT="no-cache">
    <META HTTP-EQUIV="Expires" CONTENT="-1">

Resolution (1): Convert tag and attributes to lowercase and replace the closing ">" with " />"


2)
    <script language="javascript">
      var contextPath = '$req.contextPath';
    </script>

3)
    <script src="$req.contextPath/decorators/effects.js"></script>

Resolution (2, 3): the language attribute is deprecated.  If it's going to be included, you should also have the required type attribute.  Add: type="text/javascript" to the opening script element.


4)
        <meta name="robots" content="noindex,nofollow">
        <meta name="robots" content="noarchive">

5)
       <link rel="shortcut icon" href="$req.contextPath/images/icons/favicon.ico">
       <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="$req.contextPath/images/icons/favicon.png">

Resolution (4, 5): Missing closing tag required for XHTML.  Change ">" to " />" instead.

Thanks!


PS: Not sure if this is a "bug" (I'd call it a bug) or an "improvement".  Sorry!
fields.summary: Make standardHeader() macro properly XHTML compliant like other bits of HTML

fields.description:
After reloading the page, the content is displayed correctly. However, the page seems not to stop loading content from the server.

The first time the page is loaded, the "blank" page with a grey background is loaded into the editor, but the content (with a white background) never replaces it. That would indicate there's a problem in loading the content to the editor.

If wiki markup is the default mode, the markup editor displays fine, and you can switch to the rich text editor with no problems.

A workaround is to reload the page after the first load, or to make wiki markup the default.

Might be related to CONF-4808. We will need to test whether upgrading solved this issue.

fields.description:
With the combination of JIRA 3.4.1 and Confluence 2.0.1 I've again the problem with the JIRAPORTLET (See Screenshot).

Since I have an installation of JIRA and Confluence on Monday, the 5th Dec. at our customer-site this is a blocker for my project. The integration of JIRA into Confluence is a central topic of our concept!! And this is once again not working.

Please; I need a solution until Friday!

Attached also the JIRA XML-backup and the related Confluence-XML backup!
--------------------------------
Here is the complete command (this is just one example of a bunch of not working JIRAPORTLET renderings) and the complete error message.
{jiraportlet:url=http://alexanderwnb.mgm-edv.de:8080/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:filterstats&filterid=10160&statistictype=issuetype&os_username=eoreader&os_password=eo}

Error-message:

fields.description:
When you edit a page with a confluence link containing international characters, it stops working.

Try a link to "Göteborg Test" and then edit it using the rich text edit and save - broken.
fields.summary: Confluence link with international characters stops working after edit

fields.description:
Confluence 2.0, Red Hat Linux.  MySQL backend.

1. Create a new space, call it whatever you like.
2. Copy link to new space's Home and send to someone who shouldn't have permission to view it
3. When they click the link, it shows that the page wasn't found, but asks if they wanted the page they were just trying to access.  It even gives an excerpt from that page. Even if they don't have permission to view it!

Leaks only a small amount of information, but it allows the user to get access to stuff they've been denied access to.  Bad.
fields.summary: Information leak when accessing url directly

fields.description:
I could not find a way to link to a news item, other than linking with a full html link, which will fail if the wiki is expose under different URLs (Intranet/Extranet)

Do I miss th edocumentation or is this a bug or missing feature?

Kind regards

Kaj
fields.summary: Link to news item

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4792].
  {panel}

The only thing displayed when viewing trash is the page name.  In order to determine what trash should be purged, I need to know more information.  Some or all of the following would be nice.
1) What date was it deleted?  (allow sort by date)
2) Who deleted the page?
3) Ability to view the page contents without restoring it - probably just the source would be enough
fields.summary: Display more details for pages in the trash: "who","when","why","what"

fields.description:
The dates displayed in search results for emails displays the date imported rather than displaying the date sent.

So an email sent on the November 15, 2005 and imported into Confluence on November 30, 2005 will show the date November 30, 2005 when the email appears in any search results.

Can we update this so the date of the object in Confluence is the date the email was sent, as taken from the email's header.
fields.summary: Search results for emails displays date imported rather than displaying the date sent
Headers of emails need to include time sent

fields.description:
By default, the MSSQL hibernate dialect creates char, varchar and text columns when defining a schema. These fields do not support Unicode characters. Instead, we need to user nchar, nvarchar and ntext columns.

What we want to do is create a hibernate dialect that can be used that creates the correct unicode column types.

----- Some background info:

In Microsoft SQL Server, these data types support Unicode data:

nchar

nvarchar

ntext


Note  The n prefix for these data types comes from the SQL-92 standard for 
National (Unicode) data types.

Use of nchar, nvarchar, and ntext is the same as char, varchar, and text, 
respectively, except that:

Unicode supports a wider range of characters.

More space is needed to store Unicode characters.

The maximum size of nchar and nvarchar columns is 4,000 characters, not 8,000 
characters like char and varchar.

Unicode constants are specified with a leading N: N'A Unicode string'.

All Unicode data uses the same Unicode code page. Collations do not control the 
code page used for Unicode columns, only attributes such as comparison rules and 
case sensitivity. 
------------------------------
fields.summary: Need to support UNICODE characters in MSSQL server.

fields.description:
It appears that an HSQL export generates data that is too large for postgres. 

Is this a character encoding problem similar to MySQL, where MySQL stores character in 3 bytes meaning that defined keys must be a 3rd the size?
fields.summary: Exporting from HSQL and importing into Postgres results in invalid data size errors.

fields.description:
Allow the {gallery} macro to have a "sort by" argument that would allow sorting by filename or by date of the file.  Maybe even allow reording of attachments.  Even better would be if there were an EXIF extractor that would allow sorting by the date the photo was taken.   This would allow Confluence to be used as a replacement for a photo gallery program such as NGallery, etc. (and would allow me to stop using NGallery at the very least).

Response from Atlassian support regarding the same topic is below ...

Paul, 

it is currently not possible to change the order of the images within the gallery macro. It would be fairly straight forward to extend the macro to allow for sorting the images by name or by date. 

If you would like to see a feature like this added to Confluence, or have any further ideas or suggestions, please file a request at http://jira.atlassian.com. This will allow other users to vote for the request and add comment on it.

Cheers,
Jens
fields.summary: Allow {gallery} macro to sort by filename or by date

fields.description:
When browsing a page and then decide you'll need to edit the page, the current page location used to be retained.  Now, when logging in, rather than going to the page, you will be redirected to the Dashboard again. 

This bug was introduced during the Seraph enhancements for 2.0.
fields.summary: Login does not redirect to last page location

fields.description:
In the case where the content of a table is updated, the second-level cache is not flushed after the task has completed. This can lead to unpredictable errors in the use of the system, until it is shut down (and the cache rebuilt when Confluence starts up again).

One such issue (CONF-4765) is where the SPACEDESCRIPTION objects in the CONTENT table were updated to reflect a change made somewhere around 1.3.5. Without this change, the space key for a Space Description object would be null. Although the record was updated in the database, the second-level cache (CacheManager) did not reflect this change, and so errors would occur when dealing with the Space Description until a restart.
fields.summary: Upgrade tasks do not flush the cache after updating content

fields.description:
When using umlaute (presumably special characters in general) like ä in the page title, the Rich Text editor has problems with the encoding. It seems like after saving the page, the problem starts to occur. 

Example:

1. Create a new page
2. setting page title to: Hallo ÖÄÜ
3. Adding link to the new page in page 2, save, link is ok.
4. Editing page 2, press save and the link is shown correct but the plus sign appears for creating new page.
5. when editing page 2 again the link looks like this: Hallo ÖÄÜ (in the wiki markup: [Hallo &#xD6;&#xC4;&#xDC;])
fields.summary: Umlaute in links are causing encoding problems with the Rich Text editor

fields.description:
In http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Remote+API+Specification,
the spec on addPermission etc has an argument "permission" which is documented as
---
Permission
Key	 Type	 Value
lockType	 String	 The type of lock. One of 'creator' or 'group'
lockedBy	 String	 The user- or group-name of the lock's owne
---
this looks more like "Lock" than "Permission" to me. Could you please update this, as we would like to use it?

 -- Ingomar
fields.summary: Remote API Spec: "Permission"

fields.summary: Exception thrown while accessing "News"

fields.description:
Summary: Emoticon graphics used in info panel macros don't appear in WYSIWYG Wiki Preview mode because the path is incorrect. Discussion: If you use the Confluence tip, info, etc. panel macros, the associated icons, stored in the emoticon icon directory, don't appear when you switch from Wiki markup mode to Preview mode in the WYSIWYG editor. This turns out to be because the generated icon path in the HTML in Preview mode is incorrect. However, using emoticons themselves, even the same one used in the panel, seems to be correct. For example, if I define a page which contains only the following Wiki markup: {noformat:title=noformat added for display. not part of example} {tip:title=Weekly News Flash!|icon=true} - Excellent adventures last week into Blackrock Depths and a joint raid adventure in the Sunken Temple with the Roses of the Dawn. Look out for more cross-guild raids and adventures in the near future. {tip} (\) {noformat} When I switch to Preview mode, the following HTML is generated: {code:html}
Weekly News Flash!
  • Excellent adventures last week into Blackrock Depths and a joint raid adventure in the Sunken Temple with the Roses of the Dawn. Look out for more cross-guild raids and adventures in the near future.

{code} The path for the icon in the info panel should be /confluence/images/icons/emoticons/check.gif, identical to the later path generated by the (/) emoticon macro, and not just /images/icons/emoticons/check.gif appearing here.
fields.summary: Emoticon graphics for info panel macros not displayed in WYIWYG Preview mode

fields.description:
It seems that in 1.3.5 or earlier, the Space ID of a Space was not populated. Thus, in later versions, when the Space of a SpaceDescription is referenced, null is returned and problems may occur. (See CONF-4672.) This can be fixed by writing an upgrade task to match the Space Description in the Spaces table with the record in the Content table and set the Space ID.

NOTE: This only seems to occur when updating an instance from 1.3.5 -> 2.0 by pointing the instance to the old database. Doing a backup and restore seems to fix the null space ID.
fields.summary: Space Descriptions may not have their Space ID set, causing problems when the space is referenced

fields.description:
If I want to get more changed details about a page in dashborad, I must use 3 clicks at least annoyingly, one click to the page,  another click to Info tab of that page, the last click on 'view changes' to my destination finally.

Would add shortcut link for comparing with previous revision in 'recently updated' pane in dashborad conveniently
fields.summary: Add shortcut link for comparing with previous revision in 'recently updated' pane

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4761].
  {panel}

viewmylabels.action shows you what content you've labelled, but it'd be nice to see next to each one, _all_ the labels you've placed on that content, including global labels

i.e.

[#] Page Name
      My labels: foo, bar, my:baz
fields.summary: viewmylabels.action should show what you've labeled content with

fields.description: The resin functional tests have started running out of memory at 64Mb. I have temporarily upped the heap for the Resin tests so they'll run, but I can't see any reason why Confluence _shouldn't_ run in 64Mb with the tiny amount of data we use in the funktests. Should be investigated.
fields.summary: Functional tests fail in 64Mb server heap

fields.description: The documentation for the spaces-list macro needs to be updated to include the options to view spaces via 'My', 'Team', 'New' or 'All'  tabs

fields.description: Somehow people here never realize (or remember, or bother...) that there is a special, printable version of each page. If the print layout was specified in a style sheet associated with the "print" media type, this would be no issue. See also JRA-3658.
fields.summary: Specify a print style sheet

fields.description:
Getting the following error during the configuration wizard step where an admin account is created. See the stack trace below. 

Manually changing the database schema so that boolean_val column in os_propertyentry table is of type bit(8) fixes the problem. Guessing that Hibernate 2.1.6 (version used in Confluence 2.0) does not speak the MySQL 5.0 dialect very well. This will probably fix itself once a more recent version of Hibernate is used. Filing a bug anyway so that this can be tracked.

fields.description:
It would be good if Confluence could show all of the changes made to a single file in one day as an option.  If a file is on Version 2 before the day starts, and I make three changes (v3, v4, v5), the daily email will say that I made the last change and the (view changes) link will show v4->v5.  This is somewhat misleading, as it ignores the fact that I made two other changes.

Some other options might include:

_My Page_ changed by 2 users (_view changes: 2->5_), last by Geoffrey (view changes: 4-5)

etc.

I know that finding the right amount of space in the email could be a problem, but MOST of the time I want to see all of the changes in a day, rather than the last, and it's awkward to do it manually.
fields.summary: Daily digest email notification only shows most recent edit for each page

fields.description:
Summary:
Disabling WYSIWYG editor via General Configuration means that tinyMCE is not defined on the "Preview" page.  You can't go back to the "WikiMarkup" page.

Discussion:
The editor doesn't seem to work for me in Camino (1.01a -- Gecko browser for the Mac).  When the "Edit" page first appears, a normal-size text window with the page content appears briefly and then is quickly replaced by a full-window-width Rich Text editor with no content.  I decided to make the Rich Text editor the default editor and then later to disable it completely for everyone using the Administration preference in "General Configuration".

After I did that, the Rich Text editor doesn't appear as a tab when editing a page, which is fine.  However, if you edit the page, go to "Preview" and then try to go back to the "WikiMarkup" page, you just get a spinning disc (very Mac OS X-like, by the way).  Checking the JavaScript console in Firefox (this didn't work for me in Camino either), it's complaining that "tinyMCE" is not defined in the line:

                var html = tinyMCE.getContent();

However, if you have the Rich Text editor enabled in the preferences but you're using the "WikiMarkup" editor, you don't get this error when going to "Preview" and back to "WikiMarkup".  My guess is when you've disabled the Rich Text editor, the page doesn't load the relevant JavaScript classes/objects for it (but you don't check for that!) and so it fails.

If you try this in Safari 2.0.2, this isn't what happens.  Safari 2.0.2 uses the "old" preview method, familiar from Confluence 1.4.x.
fields.summary: Disabling WYSIWYG editor causes AJAX error in Preview mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4744].
  {panel}

Hello,

we would like to enable the trackback component between our Jira and Confluence installation. As I read in some discussions, we can´t finally use the trackback function because anonymous access is assumed on both sides. Because we don´t want to open the systems for general access, we ask you to enhance this component with the login feature.

A solution was already described in the Jira issue JRA-5063 (http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-5063)

Best regards,
Heiko Burghardt
fields.summary: Login feature for trackback component

fields.description:
Have a look  if we can write a neat HSQL query. The SQL should look something like this:

select * from SPACEPERMISSIONS sp join SPACES s on sp.SPACEID = s.SPACEID
where (sp.PERMUSERNAME = 'admin'
or sp.PERMGROUPNAME in ('confluence-user', 'confluence-admins'))
and sp.PERMTYPE = 'VIEWSPACE'
fields.summary: All spaces a user can see should be retrieved with one query
